\section{json\_csv\_to\_xml module}
\label{\detokenize{json_csv_to_xml:module-json_csv_to_xml}}\label{\detokenize{json_csv_to_xml:json-csv-to-xml-module}}\label{\detokenize{json_csv_to_xml::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!json\_csv\_to\_xml@\spxentry{json\_csv\_to\_xml}}\index{json\_csv\_to\_xml@\spxentry{json\_csv\_to\_xml}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{convert\_json\_csv\_to\_xml() (in module json\_csv\_to\_xml)@\spxentry{convert\_json\_csv\_to\_xml()}\spxextra{in module json\_csv\_to\_xml}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{json_csv_to_xml:json_csv_to_xml.convert_json_csv_to_xml}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json\_csv\_to\_xml.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{convert\_json\_csv\_to\_xml}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{files\_to\_process}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{coord\_file}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{output\_folder}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This function take a list of json files containing data about Tumor, Extraepithelial CD8+ Cell and
Intraepithelial CD8+ Cell, a csv file containing the coordinates of the centroids of every hotspot
and an output folder as input and create xml files that can be loaded in ASAP.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files\_to\_process}} \textendash{} list of path to json files containing annotations.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{coord\_file}} \textendash{} path to the csv file containing the centroids coordinates, the radius length and the id of every hotspot images.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{output\_folder}} \textendash{} path to the output directory.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{derivation() (in module json\_csv\_to\_xml)@\spxentry{derivation()}\spxextra{in module json\_csv\_to\_xml}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{json_csv_to_xml:json_csv_to_xml.derivation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json\_csv\_to\_xml.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{derivation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{reader}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{core\_id}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This function take a csv reader and the id of a hotspot as input. It returns the coordinates of the centroid and
the length of the radius for the hotspot with the id “core\_id”.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reader}} \textendash{} csv reader of the csv file containing the centroids coordinates, the radius length and the id of every hotspot.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{core\_id}} \textendash{} id of the current hotspot.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
a tuple containing the centroids coordinates and the radius length.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{json\_to\_csv module}
\label{\detokenize{json_to_csv:module-json_to_csv}}\label{\detokenize{json_to_csv:json-to-csv-module}}\label{\detokenize{json_to_csv::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!json\_to\_csv@\spxentry{json\_to\_csv}}\index{json\_to\_csv@\spxentry{json\_to\_csv}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{convert\_json\_to\_csv() (in module json\_to\_csv)@\spxentry{convert\_json\_to\_csv()}\spxextra{in module json\_to\_csv}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{json_to_csv:json_to_csv.convert_json_to_csv}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json\_to\_csv.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{convert\_json\_to\_csv}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{files\_to\_process}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{output\_folder}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This function take a list of json files containing data about Tumor, Extraepithelial CD8+ Cell and
Intraepithelial CD8+ Cell and an output folder as input and create a .CSV files of the interested features
in the output folder.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files\_to\_process}} \textendash{} list of path to json files containing annotations.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{output\_folder}} \textendash{} path to the output directory.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{json\_to\_xml module}
\label{\detokenize{json_to_xml:module-json_to_xml}}\label{\detokenize{json_to_xml:json-to-xml-module}}\label{\detokenize{json_to_xml::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!json\_to\_xml@\spxentry{json\_to\_xml}}\index{json\_to\_xml@\spxentry{json\_to\_xml}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{convert\_json\_to\_xml() (in module json\_to\_xml)@\spxentry{convert\_json\_to\_xml()}\spxextra{in module json\_to\_xml}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{json_to_xml:json_to_xml.convert_json_to_xml}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json\_to\_xml.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{convert\_json\_to\_xml}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{files\_to\_process}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{hotspot\_folder}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{output\_folder}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This function take a list of json files containing data about Tumor, Extraepithelial CD8+ Cell and
Intraepithelial CD8+ Cell, a hotspot folder of xml files containing the coordinates of the hotspots
and an output folder as input and create xml files that can be loaded in ASAP in the output folder.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files\_to\_process}} \textendash{} list of path to json files containing annotations.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{hotspot\_folder}} \textendash{} path to the directory containing the xml files with the coordinates of the hotspots.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{output\_folder}} \textendash{} path to the output directory.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
